direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve handling the presence or absence of a value and invoking consumers accordingly.
Both methods manage the state of the value and invoke consumers when the value is set.
Both methods involve transforming or setting a value based on the current state of the object.
Both methods involve setting or transforming values and managing deferred operations.
Both methods involve logging or handling values, though one is specifically for logging.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require setting up consumers to handle the presence of a value.
Both methods require setting up consumers to handle the setting of a value.
Mapping operations may need to be tested in conjunction with setting a value.
Flat mapping operations may need to be tested in conjunction with setting a value.
Both methods involve checking the presence of a value, which can inform assertions.
Both methods involve checking if a value has been set, which can inform assertions.
